intro: Fagara schinifolia var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fagara, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are typically small berries that turn red when mature. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
